alert.note: Alert for Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 3:26PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Payette, southwestern Washington and northeastern Malheur Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Keeney Pass, or 14 miles southwest of Ontario, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Vale and Nyssa around 430 PM MDT. Ontario and Fruitland around 440 PM MDT. Payette and Moores Hollow around 450 PM MDT. Weiser, Annex and Indian Head Mountain around 500 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
